context: As an adolescent, he had a particular love of <a0_0><b5_0>theology<b5_0/><a0_0/> and the Scriptures became the foundation of his spirituality. During his studies in Palencia, <a2_0>Spain<a2_0/>, <b6_0>he experienced a dreadful famine<b6_0/>, prompting Dominic to sell all of his beloved books and other equipment <a1_0><b7_0>to help his neighbors<b7_0/><a1_0/>. After he completed his studies, Bishop Martin Bazan and Prior Diego d'Achebes appointed <b9_0>Dominic<b9_0/> to <b8_0>the cathedral chapter<b8_0/> and he became a regular canon under the Rule of <a4_0>St. Augustine<a4_0/> and the Constitutions for the cathedral church of Osma. At the age of twenty-four or <a3_0>twenty-five<a3_0/>, he was ordained to the priesthood.
